title: 'House of horrors' mum 'poured boiling water on toddler after he peed on floor'
text:

A mum allegedly poured a pot of boiling water over a three-year-old boy to punish him for peeing on the floor.

Patricia Buchan, 29, admitted to ordering the tot to strip before dumping the scalding liquid on him at their apartment in Newark, New Jersey, reports say.

It is said the boy, who was under Buchan's care, lived in a squalid 'house of horrors' with five other adults and another five children.

The then-pregnant Buchan reportedly told the child to get in a bath, boiled water on the stove and then poured it over his lower body, badly burning the youngster.

(Image: Essex County Prosecutor's Office)

(Image: Essex County Prosecutor's Office)

According to NJ.com, Essex County Assistant Prosecutor Michael Morris said: "This child lived his first three years in a house of horrors.

"Today’s plea resolves the case without the ordeal of the children having to testify."

The boy was exposed to a five-month campaign of abuse in the New Jersey apartment, suffering repeated beatings, before being burnt in December, it is claimed.

(Image: Essex County Prosecutor's Office)

(Image: Essex County Prosecutor's Office)

Pre-school officials told police about the boy's brutal treatment, sparking an investigation which resulted in Buchan and her five adult roommates being arrested and charged.

The boy was being regularly abused between July and December, it is claimed.

The adults even encouraged the other children in the home to beat the child, prosecutors say.

(Image: Essex County Prosecutor's Office)

(Image: Essex County Prosecutor's Office)

Natacha Smith, Mary Buchan, Homer Searcy, Bridget Buchan, and Patricia Gamarra's cases are still pending, while Buchan is due to be sentenced on December 6.

The abused boy and the other five children in the apartment, four of whom are Buchan's kids, are now in protective custody.

The other youngsters are all aged between one and seven, according to a report.
description: The three-year-old boy was repeatedly beaten for five months in a squalid New Jersey 'house of horrors'
